name: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Performance Indicators per Agency: Beginning 2008
attribution: MTA Headquarters, New York City Transit, Long Island Rail Road, Metro-North Railroad, MTA Bus and MTA Bridges and Tunnels
description: This information comes from the MTA’s Performance Dashboard and is used to increase transparency at the MTA. The Key Performance Indicators (KPI) are used to track performance is areas such as On Time Performance.

columns.name: Indicator Sequence
columns.description: A unique identifying sequence number associated with a KPI.

columns.name: Parent Sequence
columns.description: This indicates that the KPI is a Sun-Indicator and contains the indicator sequence value of the Parent  KPI.

columns.name: Agency Name
columns.description:
This identifies the agency asscoiated with the KPI. 
Bridges and Tunnels, Long Island Rail Road, MTA Bus, Metro-North Railroad, NYC Transit

columns.name: Indicator Name
columns.description: This a short name of the KPI

top.item: Employee Lost Time and Restricted Duty Rate
Employee Lost Time and Restricted Duty Rate

columns.name: Description
columns.description: This is a full description of the KPI

cachedContents.largest: Wait Assessment (WA), which is measured weekdays between 6:00 am - midnight, is defined as the percent of actual intervals between trains that are no more than the scheduled interval plus 25%.

top.item: The percent of total scheduled bus trips completed
Wait Assessment (WA), which is measured weekdays between 6:00 am - midnight, is defined as the percent of actual intervals between trains that are no more than the scheduled interval plus 25%.
Subways weekday Terminal OTP evaluates performance based on schedule/service plan in effect, includes all delays.

The percent of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the schedule. Individual branch-line targets are not currently calculated. However, the LIRR expects to acheive a system-wide on-time performance target of at least 95%.
Percent of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the scheduled time.

The number of passengers from whom the agency receives a fare (cash, train tickets, time-based passes, etc.) Ridership data is preliminary and subject to revision as well as adjustments warranted by annual audit review.
An employee lost time injury or illness is one that prevents an employee from returning to work for at least one full shift.  The rate is injuries and illnesses per 200,000 worker hours.

An injury resulting from an incident on the bus system that occurred while the person was boarding the bus, onboard the bus, or alighting from the bus. Assaults are not included. The rate is the number of injuries per million customers.   In 2009, the methodology was revised to ensure consistency in the data across the bus companies.

An injury resulting from a collision between a bus and another vehicle, an object, a person, or an animal. Includes people injured in other vehicles.  The rate is the number of collisions with injuries per million miles. In 2009, the methodology was revised to ensure consistency of data across the bus companies.
Average number of miles a railcar travels before a  mechanical failure makes the train arrive at its final destination later than 5 minutes and 59 seconds.

Percent of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the scheduled time.  Metro-North Railroad contracts with New Jersey Transit to operate service on the Pascack Valley Line.

Percent of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the scheduled time.  Metro-North Railroad contracts with New Jersey Transit to operate service on the Port Jervis Line.
Percent of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the scheduled time. East of Hudson service includes the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven lines.
An employee lost time injury or illness is one that prevents an employee from returning to work for at least one full shift.  The rate is injuries and illnesses per 100 employees.
Any injury to a customer as a result of an incident within/on railroad property.  Included are injuries that result from an assault or crime. The rate is injuries per million customers.

Percent of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the scheduled time. West of Hudson services include the Pascack Valley and Port Jervis lines. Metro-North Railroad contracts with New Jersey Transit to operate service on these lines.
The number of vehicles that pass through toll booths using either E-ZPass or cash as payment.
Average number of miles a railcar travels before a mechanical failure makes the train arrive at its final destination later than 5 minutes and 59 seconds
All customer collisions with injuries on B&T property.  The rate is collisions with injuries per million vehicles.

The percentage of commuter trains that arrive at their destinations within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of the schedule. Individual branch-line targets are not currently calculated. However, the LIRR expects to acheive a system-wide on-time performance target of at least 95%.

cachedContents.smallest: All customer collisions with injuries on B&T property.  The rate is collisions with injuries per million vehicles.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: KPIs can fall under the following three categories: Safety Indicators, Service Indicators and Financial Indicators.

columns.name: Frequency
columns.description:
This field indicates how often data for a given indicator is reported:
A=Annual
M=Monthly
Q=Quarterly
S=Semi-Annual

columns.name: Desired Change
columns.description:
The direction of a performance trend that is considered positive or “good news.” Up or Down trends can be considered "good news" depending on the KPI.
D=Down
N=Neutral
U=Up

columns.name: Indicator Unit
columns.description:
A measure of the progress toward achieving a Business Unit’s goal. Each indicator will have a description and associated values which may be a
number, percent, dollar, or amount or time.
($)=Dollars
(%)=Percentage
(-)=Number

columns.name: Decimal Places
columns.description:
The number of decimal places that should be printed or shown for the indicator value (to the right of the decimal point).
E.g. (2)=two decimial places

columns.name: Period Year
columns.description: This is the year of the reported KPI value

columns.name: Period Month
columns.description: This is the month of the reported KPI value

columns.name: YTD Target
columns.description: This is the expected YTD target value for each month.

columns.name: YTD Actual
columns.description: This is the expected YTD actual value for each month.

columns.name: Monthly Target
columns.description: This is the expected MONTHLY target value for each month.

columns.name: Monthly Actual
columns.description: This is the expected MONTHLY actual value for each month.

Dataset Summary.Coverage: New York Metropolitan Area and Connecticut

Notes.Notes: Based on the ability on collecting the KPI information, there is a two month lag between the data and month it is published.  e.g., A file published in April will only contain data up till February.
